content.description: Sit start on two crimps on opposite sides of the prow. Work your way straight-up on man-made holds. A big move to the finish can be lessened with use of a mono pocket intermediate. WARNING: This climb ascends right above a large boulder on the Â ground, bring some pads
content.protection: A pad and a spotter or AT LEAST two pads.
content.location: Climb nearly dead middle of the boulder, right up the protruding portion of the face and to the right of the overhang.

content.description:
Start standing with a right hand undercling on the mummy's right hip and a left on the mummy's left shoulder. Feet go on a shelf underneath the mummy's. Without revealing the entire beta, right hand into the dual/mono pocket. Traverse left on pockets to the prow of the rock, then climb straight up. Essentially from the start, traverse to the route "

Sphinx

", and top out.

Sarcophagus is a one-move-wonder.

Start sitting on the ground. Your left hand goes on top of the boulder and your right hand goes on the edge. Place your left foot on a tiny ledge and right foot heel-hook on the top of the boulder. From this position, swing onto the top of boulder, and mantel up it.
content.location: It is on a small, long boulder in the landing area of the main Mummy Boulder.

content.description: Start sitting on a shallow crimp and two/three finger pocket. Climb up, and once you reach the vertical slotted hold, begin traversing left on pockets until you reach the end. A single good ledge exists while traversing. I've made an extremely detailed route with every hold pointed out that is in the photos sections. No feet are mapped, which is certainly the hardest part about this.
content.location: It is between the north (left) end of the boulder and prow, about 5 feet in from the north end of the boulder, under the overhang.

content.description: This is a right-to-left traverse. Use the top of the boulder for your hands and what little the rock has to offer for your feet. Start standing on the far right (southern end), and traverse the top, to the left (northern end). The crux is after the overhang as it becomes quite slopey.
Dyno to the top off of a left hand, three-finger pocket and your right hand in the next pocket.
content.location: It is between the mummy and the prow of the rock.
